basics.name: Jake Hoffner
basics.label: Technical Leader / Web Architect
highlights: 16 years of professional software development experience.
Co-founded a VC funded startup in 2012.
First professional job was at the age of 20.
Started as a designer & front-end developer.
Has worked on Federal, State, Military, B2B and Consumer applications.

work.title: CTO
work.summary: As co-founder and CTO, I am responsible primarily for managing the technical side of the company. In the early days I was the sole developer, eventually bringing in and managing contract developers and finally a full-time development team. I manage that team while continuing to contribute as a principle developer. As co-founder I also split product development, UX design and project management responsibilities with my co-founder.

work.title: Lead Web Developer
work.summary: I was originally brought in for a year contract to work on the DirecTV website. The contract ended up being extended another 3 years, with me eventually taking a full-time position with their product development team to manage their prototype development.

Razorfish is a consulting firm that does both design and development work for popular brands such as the NFL and Audi. At the time the development staff in their LA office was almost fully commited to another project. I was brought in to help lead their development efforts on a smaller project.
work.title: Presentation Layer Developer (Contract)
Software Developer
work.summary: Boom was an early startup, basically Pandora for XBox/Playstation. It provided SDK's for game developers to integrate into their software. Curated playlists were used to match player's musical preferences with the context of the game - in order to enhance the gaming experience. The company eventually failed due to the inability to obtain series B funding.

work.title: Software Developer
work.summary: My first full-time development position. I originally interviewed for a web designer position but recent development work I had done with a Flash website motivated them to hire me as a developer instead. As they were a dev shop, I worked on numurious projects, many of which were for government and military. Eventually the company was acquired by Smith (formally Ascentium).

items.text: I co-founded Codewars.com, writing ~95% of the codebase myself.

items: Build innovative products that make an impact
Ability to be a core contributor to product decisions
Be exposed to new challenges that push my limits
Continue to mature as a skilled technical leader

interests.category: Roles & Technologies I prefer to work with
Roles & Technologies I want to avoid at all costs
Roles & Technologies I want to learn or improve at
Challenges that interest me the most

projects.name: Codewars.com
projects.summary: Codewars.com enables developers to dramatically improve their coding skills through the use of small coding challenges called "kata". It has a user base of over 150k developers, who must first pass a series of simple programming tests before they can sign up.

highlights.text: I personally programmed ~90% of the site's codebase.
Extended `Rails` to handle the concept known as PJAX on a more integrated and deeper level.
Implemented a concept dubbed DJAX (Deferred AJAX) to allow `Rails` to handle slow-client requests by leveraging Web Sockets and Redis.
Built a custom client-side templating engine complete with limited two-way bindings utilizing jQuery as the core framework.
Built a custom client-side application framework built on top of jQuery that uses a hybrid design leveraging PJAX.
Architected the entire `Rails` API and MongoDB data model for the site.
Utilized advanced caching techniques by leveraging Redis and Memcached services together.
Managed a team of contracted developers that were brought in to enhance portions of the site.

projects.name: Strive.co
projects.summary: Strive.co is recruitement based product focused on placing skilled web developers into their dream positions.

highlights.text: Improved jbuilder performance by bypassing the need to use the `Rails` templating system.
Built a sophisticated and flexible `Rails` API scheme that allowed for multiple front-end clients to interface with it.
Implemented a micro-service oriented architecture leveraging Docker and Nginx to link Node.js and `Rails` services together.
Quickly learned AngularJS so that I could contribute to the codebase along with the rest of the front-end team.
Architected the entire Rails API and MongoDB data model for the site.
Utilized advanced caching techniques by leveraging Redis and Memcached services together.
Wrote Bash scripts to deploy Docker based architecture to AWS.
Managed AWS infrastructure, including ECS & EC2.
Implemented a Neo4j database to map our database as a knowledge graph, which was used for analytics, reporting and predictive matching.
Managed a small team of full-time web developers.
Planned and ran weekly agile planning meetings.
Shared product design and roadmap planning responsibilities with my co-founder.

Managed the growth hacking experiments for the team and implement various experiments of my own. This includes writing blog entries, Twitter integrations, A/B testing of email & in-app marketing campaigns, etc.

projects.name: CodeRunner
projects.summary: A code execution engine that supports safely executing code challenges within a sandbox. Used by both Strive and Codewars.

highlights.text: Designed a system that was able to handle hundreds's of concurrent dynamic code executions requests with a scalable architecture.
Able to execute code within Python, JavaScript, Ruby, Java, C#, Clojure, Haskell & CoffeeScript.
Unique feature of the engine is that it returns test case output, allowing test cases to be ran alonside of the user provided code.
Individual Docker containers were used to safely execute each API request within their own sandbox.
Redis was used to enable a cluster of workers to pull from a queue.

projects.name: Developer Resume
projects.summary: The site that you are viewing now (if being viewed by web) was originally developed during an internal hackathon that I arranged for me and my development team. Each of us were giving 2 days to come up with our own project that was meant to innovate within the realm of our product.

highlights.text: Quickly developed within 2 days, I was able to illustrate to the team how we could implement an interactive resume that would allow employeers to drill down into the details that they care about most.
The site is an AngularJS app with no backend. It parses a YAML file into a JSON file during deployment via Gulp.

The site was developed under the concept that it would be easily forkable and eventually tie into our Strive service via Yeoman & Gulp, which would allow us to provide import/export and data cleanup features to the OS development community.

projects.name: MagLev
projects.summary: A set of Rails extensions to super charge the development process. It was a set of best practices that came out of building 2 different websites (Codewars & Strive) with Rails.

highlights.text: Built a number of ActiveJob extensions for handling sophisticated async workflows and backend data processing.
Implemented a listener pattern that makes it far easier to implement sophisticated systems while keeping a maintable codebase.

projects.name: Stateful
projects.summary: An easy to use but powerful state machine for Ruby. It was custom built instead of using other existing gems because none of the other solutions supported features that were needed.

highlights.text: Unique feature of the gem is the ability to create grouped states.
Gem provides an easy DSL for managing state changes and the events related to them.
Implementing this gem within the Codewars and Strive codebases significantly increased the ability to maintain a complex and constantly evolving codebase.

projects.name: Mongoidal
projects.summary: Mongoid on steroids - this gem contains a large number of add-on improvements to the Mongoid library.

projects.name: Batcan
projects.summary: Simple and expressive permissions system for Ruby on Rails projects.

highlights.text: Created a much more natural and logic alternative to using the CanCan gem.

projects.name: DirecTV.com
projects.summary: I lead the JavaScript development team for the .com team. My role was that of an "integrator" which meant I was also responsible for cordinating and integrating frontend and backend codebases.

highlights.text: Lead all JavaScript development effort for the website. Trained, mentored and code reviewed all other JavaScript developers on the team.
Rebuilt the legacy codebase to use a modern framework approach while still leveraging the underlying Prototype.JS library.
Was responsible for light weight integration of the Backend Web Development ATG/Java components with the Frontend Web Development codebase.
Was responsible for picking, managing and maintaining our project management solution (Target Process).
Worked with multiple teams to help develop a project management process that was both agile and still worked within the company's otherwise waterfall management style.

projects.name: DPEG
projects.summary: As a part of a team dedicated to exploring innovative forward thinking products, I created an internal tool for rapidly prototyping web apps.

highlights.text: Brainstormed with the team and played a role in making product decisions for future DirecTV web products.
Prototyped future app ideas utilizing Ruby on Rails and jQuery

projects.name: Parsons.com
projects.summary: The site was built on top of MS Sharepoint, since the organization already made so much use of the product internally.

highlights.text: Used jQuery to create front-end components for a Sharepoint backed website.
Handled some backend C#/Sharepoint development when needed.
Integrated Google Maps deeply into the product, such as widgets and dynamic content

projects.name: JSON API
projects.summary: I was a core contributor to the company's application API, which was used both by our website and game SDKs.

highlights.text: Refactored and Simplified C# business objects to allow for increased productivity.

projects.name: Internal CMS
projects.summary: I built the internal tool which was used to ingest huge amounts of song data into our system, as well as used by the content team to manage playlists.

highlights.text: Rapidly built CMS front-end utilizing Ext JS.
Designed a highly praised user experience for working with internal data.
Developed an queue/digestion system for processing batches of over 100K+ MP3 files.
Digestion system was able to scrub and reconcile data across multiple data sources.

projects.name: Microsoft CRM
projects.summary: The last 3 years of my time with the company we had shifted our focus onto being a preferred MS CRM vendor. During this time I worked with a variety of clients including Seattle 411 and USDA. We became very good at bending the capabilities of the application to do things well beyond being a CRM.

highlights.text: Created an internal SDK that allowed our team to rapidly build-out advanced applications on top of the MS CRM platform.
Worked with propsect clients to rapidly design and prototype custom CRM implementations that would work with their specific data model and needs.
Extended MS CRM well beyond its original use-case. Some use-cases include a 411 help desk, a casino "whale" tracker, real-time customer support and government management.

projects.name: Air Force Board of Corrections
projects.summary: I spent a year working on a custom windows app for the Air Force, which was used for document management by all of their departments. My primary responsibility was to implement the GUI for the app.

projects.name: Custom Web Development
projects.summary: My initial 4 years at the company was spent mostly building custom web applications for various clients such as the Maryland Department of Education and Maryland Department of Health and Hygiene.

highlights.text: On many projects I lead a small development team. I was responsible for reviewing code and delegating tasks.
Developed custom CMS and CRM applications for various clients using .NET technologies.
Was the primary person at the company responsible for UX and UI design.

projects.name: Reqeo
projects.summary: A startup idea based on recommendations for users based off of mutual followers and interests. I spent over a year working on the concept in my off-time. In the end, I created the product in too much of a vacuum. It was a hard lesson learned in the importance of keeping a product simple and getting it in front of actual users as soon as possible. It was also probably my masterpiece in terms of clean and maintanable C# code - another reason why the project failed as the time should have been spent elsewhere.

highlights.text: Built a custom client-side framework on top of jQuery to ease and DRY up development efforts. This framework was part of a similar design that I had been evolving over the passed 3 years.
Utilizing a non-standard open source ORM, I created a repository based data model that leveraged both SQL Server and MongoDB with a CQRS influenced architectual pattern.
